channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VT

item.title: Report E-2023080645
item.description:
Report E-2023080645

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: WESTMINSTER
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLL experienced a release of UN1760 NAG-75 from (4) 5-gallon poly pails and non-regulated iShine from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of each product, 10 gallons total, released as a result of improper loading. The release impacted a 6’ x 6’ area of the trailer floor and an 8’ x 12’ area of the concrete lot below. Oil dri was deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbent waste was then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All damaged pails of NAD-75 were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged pails of non-regulated iShine containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023070047
item.description:
Report I-2023070047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: Ferrisburgh
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KENAN ADVANTAGE GROUP HOLDINGS CORP.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The rear axle overheated causing a fire which spread to the tires. The fire could not be extinguished and it burnt the sides of the trailer engulfing the trailer in fire. The fire spread to the tractor and it also burned. The fire on and under the trailer heated the fire protection system in the trailer causing it to trigger. The fire protection system is intended to release the contents of the trailer to the atmosphere to prevent rupture of the pressure vessels. The gas vented to the atmosphere and ignited from the nearby fire for approximately 45 minutes.
